Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: tsuru
Description: Tsuru is the command line utility used by application developers, that will allow users to create, list, bind and manage apps

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Builds a tsuru app image respecting

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Enables single file build into the root of the app's tree

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Creates a new app using the given name and platform

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Team that will own the app

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Plan to be used by the app

Arguments.Name: -g
Arguments.Description: Tag to be used by the app

Arguments.Name: deploy
Arguments.Description: Deploys set of files and/or directories to tsuru server

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Enables single file deployment into the root of the app's tree

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: The image to deploy in app

Arguments.Name: --new-version
Arguments.Description: Creates a new version for the current deployment while preserving existing versions

Arguments.Name: --override-old-versions
Arguments.Description: Force replace all deployed versions by this new deploy

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List information about deploys for an application

Arguments.Name: rebuild
Arguments.Description: Rebuild and deploy the last app image

Arguments.Name: --new-version
Arguments.Description: Creates a new version for the current deployment while preserving existing versions

Arguments.Name: --override-old-versions
Arguments.Description: Force replace all deployed versions by this new deploy

Arguments.Name: rollback
Arguments.Description: Deploys an existing image for an app

Arguments.Name: --new-version
Arguments.Description: Creates a new version for the current deployment while preserving existing versions

Arguments.Name: --override-old-versions
Arguments.Description: Force replace all deployed versions by this new deploy

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Locks an existing image of an app

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Enables or disables the rollback on a specific image version

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: The image name for an app version

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: The reason why the rollback has to be disabled

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Allows a team to access an application

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Filter applications by unit status. Accepts multiple values separated by commas. Possible values can be: building, created, starting, error, started, stopped, asleep

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Team that will own the app

Arguments.Name: log
Arguments.Description: Shows the logs of an app

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: The log from the given source

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: The log from the given unit

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Do not restart the app after the metadata is set

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Do not restart the app after the metadata is set

Arguments.Name: quota
Arguments.Description: Shows the quota of an app

Arguments.Name: change
Arguments.Description: Changes the limit of units that an app can have

Arguments.Name: view
Arguments.Description: Displays the current usage and limit of the given app

Arguments.Name: restart
Arguments.Description: Restarts an application, or one of the processes of the application

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Removes a team access to an application

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Adds a router to an app

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: Custom options sent directly to router implementation

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Removes a router from an app

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates a router for an app

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: Custom options sent directly to router implementation

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Manage router versions for an app

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Adds a router version to an app

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Removes a router version from an app

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Runs a command inside an app

Arguments.Name: shell
Arguments.Description: Opens a remote shell inside unit, using the API server as a proxy

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Force Swap among apps with different number of units or different platform

Arguments.Name: unlock
Arguments.Description: Forces the removal of an application lock

Arguments.Name: --cpu
Arguments.Description: CPU limit for app, this will override the plan cpu value. One cpu is equivalent to 1 vCPU/Core, fractional requests are allowed and the expression 0.1 is equivalent to the expression 100m

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Forces next deploy to build app image from scratch

Arguments.Name: --memory
Arguments.Description: Memory limit for app, this will override the plan memory value. You can express memory as a bytes integer or using one of these suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, K, Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Prevent tsuru from restarting the application

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Plan to be used by the app

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Team that will own the app

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Don't restart the app after setting the env vars

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Get environment variables from an app

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Set environment variables to an app

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Don't restart the app after setting the env vars

Arguments.Name: unset
Arguments.Description: Unset environment variables from an app

Arguments.Name: --no-restart
Arguments.Description: Don't restart the app after setting the env vars

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Creates or update a TLS certificate into the specific app

Arguments.Name: unset
Arguments.Description: Unset a TLS certificate from a specific app
